description: The US is conducting a criminal antitrust investigation into pricing strategies by TP-Link Systems Inc., a California-based router maker with links to China whose equipment now dominates the American market, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Router Maker TP-Link Faces US Criminal Antitrust Investigation

description: Nearly a year after Russian President Vladimir Putin called Afghanistan’s Taliban an “ally” in countering terrorism, Moscow lifted a two-decade-old ban on the group, aiming to bolster ties with Kabul to crush a joint enemy — the Islamic State.
title: Russia Deepens Its Taliban Ties With Eye on Shared Adversary ISIS

description: The IMF’s latest jumbo loan to Argentina – a serial defaulter now led by a close Donald Trump ally – raised red flags for many of the Fund’s top decision-makers. It got a green light anyway.
title: Loan to Trump-Friendly Argentina Went Against IMF Board Concerns

description: Singaporeans will head to the polls on May 3 after a mere nine-day election campaign — among the world’s shortest timelines for voters to make a decision. The ballot comes at a particularly challenging time for the small, open, trade-dependent economy, which could suffer collateral damage in the escalating tariff war between the US and China.
title: Why Singapore’s Election Is a Key Test for New Faces of Ruling Party

description: Japanese Finance Minister Katsunobu Kato said that specific foreign-exchange targets didn’t at all come up in his talks Thursday with Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, while he did strongly urge that the US rethink its steps on tariffs.
title: Kato Says Currency Targets Were Not Discussed in Bessent Talks

description: Energy Secretary Chris Wright sought to reassure US oil companies during a visit to Oklahoma, saying turmoil from President Donald Trump’s trade war is apt to be fleeting and the administration fully supports more crude output.
title: Energy Secretary Tries to Reassure US Oil Bosses Amid Trade War

description: President Donald Trump signed a memorandum targeting ActBlue, accusing Democrats’ online campaign donation platform of violating federal election laws and calling on the US attorney general to take action.
title: Trump Signs Directive Targeting Democrats’ ActBlue Platform

description: President Donald Trump has signed an executive order intended to accelerate offshore mining and open new opportunities for extracting critical materials from the ocean floor despite the objections of environmentalists.
title: Trump Moves to Ramp Up Deep-Sea Mining for Critical Minerals

description: The US is right that global trade imbalances need to be addressed but President Donald Trump is going about it the wrong way, UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves said.
title: UK’s Reeves Says Trump Right on Imbalances But Has Wrong Answer

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk looks at the president’s latest drive to get a peace deal between Ukraine and Russia. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: War in Ukraine Moves Back to the Forefront for Trump

description: A federal judge has ordered the Trump administration to facilitate the return of a Venezuelan man who was deported to a maximum-security prison in El Salvador — the second time the administration has been told to bring back a migrant it wrongly removed.
title: US Judge Orders Return of Second Migrant From El Salvador Prison

description: The world’s finance chiefs flocked to Washington this week to see up close how President Donald Trump’s effort to overhaul the global economic order is shaking markets and eroding growth.
title: Trump’s Trade Whiplash Sinks World Into Dreaded ‘Uncertainty’

description: Ivory Coast’s main opposition party will hit the streets next month to protest the disqualification of its candidate, the former Credit Suisse Chief Executive Officer Tidjane Thiam, from running for president in elections scheduled for this year.
title: Thiam’s Party to Protest Next Month After Ivory Coast Vote Ban

description: A US judge temporarily blocked parts of President Donald Trump’s executive order that calls for major changes to US election rules, including a first-of-its-kind demand for proof of citizenship to vote.
title: Trump Order for Proof of Citizenship to Vote Blocked for Now

description: President Donald Trump’s trade tariffs have roiled financial markets, prompted an outcry from world leaders and raised the specter of a US recession. The blowback eventually prompted Trump to pause some of the most punishing tariffs for 90 days. With every move, the US president underscores that he is calling the shots, though the US Constitution gives Congress the last word in setting import duties.
title: Trump Is Using Emergency Law to Impose Tariffs. Is That Legal?

description: Two detainees who were held at the detention facility have died this year, and many more have endured long waits for basic necessities
title: Trump’s Mass-Deportation Push Overcrowds Miami’s Krome ICE Center

description: US President Donald Trump expressed confidence he would be able to reach an agreement on trade with Norway during a meeting with visiting Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Store, but stopped short of offering to roll back his “reciprocal” tariffs without concessions.
title: Trump Says He Expects to Reach Deal With Norway on Tariffs

description: The US and South Korea could reach an “agreement of understanding” on trade as soon as next week, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said Thursday, following talks between the two nations.
title: Bessent Sees US, Korea Trade ‘Understanding’ by Next Week

description: Prime Minister Mark Carney said Canada does not need to reach a quick deal with US President Donald Trump, arguing his country has enough leverage in the negotiations to wait longer if necessary.
title: Carney Says Canada Has Leverage to Wait for a US Trade Deal

description: South African Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana said he sees no reason to resign following his U-turn on a proposed tax increase that threatened to rupture the nation’s coalition government.
title: South Africa’s Godongwana Says He Won’t Resign Over VAT U-Turn

description: The US Securities and Exchange Commission is resolving a civil fraud suit against the former chief executive of the blank-check firm that helped bring Donald Trump’s social media company public.
title: SEC Resolving Suit Against SPAC CEO That Took Trump Media Public

description: Panama’s President Jose Raul Mulino stepped up nationalist rhetoric toward a shuttered copper mine in the country as his administration prepares to negotiate a potential restart with operator First Quantum Minerals Ltd.
title: Panama President Ratchets Up Nationalism Ahead of Mine Talks

description: Malaysia is revising down its growth outlook as tariffs weigh on the economy, while seeking a “fair” deal in trade talks that kick off with US officials this week, according to a top official.
title: Malaysia to Cut Growth Outlook, Discuss ‘Fair’ Trade With US

description: A trade deal that would see the European Union and the US zero out tariffs on industrial products would be the best way to resolve the current tensions, according to German Finance Minister Joerg Kukies.
title: Zero Tariffs Would Be Most Efficient EU-US Deal, Kukies Says

description: California Governor Gavin Newsom boasted that his state has become the world’s fourth-largest economy, following only the US, China and Germany in global rankings.
title: Newsom Says California Is Now the World’s Fourth-Biggest Economy

description: A federal judge temporarily blocked the Trump administration’s funding freeze for local governments with “sanctuary” policies amid the president’s crackdown on undocumented immigrants.
title: Sanctuary Cities Win Block on Trump Funding Freeze for Now

description: Behind the scenes of Andrew Cuomo’s campaign to become New York City’s next mayor, the former governor is fighting an expensive legal battle to clear his name. New Yorkers are on the hook to pay for almost all of it.
title: New Yorkers Are Paying Over $60 Million for Andrew Cuomo’s Legal Fights

description: Namibia will initiate talks on the possible development of a nuclear plant as it seeks to diversify its energy mix, President Netumbo Nandi-Ndaitwah said.
title: Uranium Producer Namibia Eyes Development of Nuclear Plant

description: The US will demand that Russia accept Ukraine’s right to develop its own, adequately equipped, army and defense industry as part of a peace agreement, according to people familiar with the matter, pushing back on Russia’s insistence that the country largely demilitarize as a condition to end the war.
title: US to Demand Putin Accept Ukraine’s Right to Military Force

description: Switzerland’s president is lobbying Trump administration officials in Washington this week, as concern mounts over the double hit to competitiveness from tariffs and a soaring currency.
title: Double Blow From Tariffs and Franc Sends Swiss President to Washington

description: Flights from India to Europe, Canada and the US will take about two hours longer and airlines will be forced to cut payloads after Pakistan closed its airspace to carriers from its neighboring nation.
title: Pakistan Closing Airspace Means India’s Airlines Will Fly Longer

description: The US and India have been edging closer for years. Washington sees India as a key regional counterweight against a more assertive China, while for New Delhi, the US has become an increasingly important source of foreign investment and a partner for trade and security.
title: How Trump Is Reshaping India’s Trade and Defense Ties With the US

description: Romania’s electoral authorities are looking into the finances of the country’s far-right presidential frontrunner days before a key vote, after details emerged of an alleged contract between his party and a US lobbying firm.
title: Romania Far-Right Frontrunner Faces Scrutiny on US Lobbying

description: The Trump Organization fired a conservative lawyer who served as its ethics adviser hours after the president attacked him for helping Harvard University sue the administration.
title: Trump Organization Fires Lawyer as President Blasts Harvard Work

description: It was supposed to be a slam dunk: once President Donald Trump was reelected, the US crypto industry would get its long-awaited regulatory clarity in the form of fresh new laws to govern the asset class.
title: Crypto Industry Is Hedging Its Bets on Format and Timing of US Legislation

description: PARIS (AP) — A high school student stabbed four other students at his school in western France on Thursday, killing at least one and injuring three others before being arrested, police said. The motive for the stabbing was unclear.
title: A French High School Student Arrested After Fatal Stabbing

description: International students targeted by President Donald Trump’s hardline immigration agenda are turning to US courts to fight the administration’s efforts.
title: The Cases to Watch as Trump Targets International Students

description: President Xi Jinping is seeking to repair ties with the European Union, painting China as the more reliable partner as Donald Trump alienates the bloc over issues from tariffs to defense.
title: Xi Seeks Detente With Europe as Trump Tariffs Alienate Bloc

description: Germany will probably fail to generate even minimal economic growth this year, according to revised government forecasts, a reminder of the scale of the challenge facing conservative Chancellor-in-waiting Friedrich Merz when he takes office next month.
title: Germany Pares Back Forecast, Sees Economy Stagnating This Year

description: Japan intends to push back against any US effort to bring it into an economic bloc aligned against China because of the importance of Tokyo’s trade ties with Beijing, according to current and former Japanese government officials.
title: Japan to Resist Trump Efforts to Form Trade Bloc Against China

description: Pakistan condemned India’s actions taken against it after a deadly attack on tourists in Kashmir, halting all trade and warning that any attempt to prevent the flow of water promised under a decades-old treaty would be considered an act of war.
title: Pakistan Hits Back at India as Kashmir Fallout Widens

description: President Donald Trump said his administration was talking with China on trade, after Beijing denied the existence of negotiations on a deal and demanded the US revoke all unilateral tariffs.
title: Trump Says US Talking With China on Trade After Beijing’s Denial
